function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Using spatially-resolved census data to infer transportation patterns in cities for urban health simulations","Impact":"Inaccurate travel habit representation may lead to incorrect disease spread predictions","Mitigation":"Validation of inferred mobility patterns using actual mobility data, sensitivity analysis of model parameters","Technologies":"GIS mapping, mobility tracking technologies","People":"Urban health researchers, policy makers","Owner":"Research institutions, government health agencies"},{"Description":"Characterizing the role of urban design in disease spread using a specific metropolitan area as an example","Impact":"Generalization of findings to other cities may lead to misinformed urban health policies","Mitigation":"Conducting studies in multiple metropolitan areas to assess the transferability of findings, considering diverse urban layouts","Technologies":"Urban planning and design software, spatial analysis tools","People":"Urban planners, policy makers","Owner":"Research institutions, government urban development agencies"},{"Description":"Running simulations in hypothetical cities to demonstrate the impact of spatial distributions of housing, education, and economic activities on epidemics","Impact":"Overgeneralization of results to actual cities may lead to inappropriate policy recommendations","Mitigation":"Cross-validation of model predictions with real-world data from multiple cities, sensitivity analysis of input parameters","Technologies":"Simulation software, data analytics tools","People":"Epidemiologists, policy analysts","Owner":"Research institutions, government health agencies"}]}
